memetic

agent.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Implements a local search technique to find a perturbation which modifies the chosen L-System to generate more difficult instances.

Author:
Farhan Ahammed (faha3615@mail.usyd.edu.au)

Starts the program.

  <program name> <ifs file>

int numnodes; printf("\n"); for (i = 0; i < names_size; i++) { numnodes = Lsystem(14, filename, names[i], "plots"); printf("%s: %d\n", names[i], numnodes); } /*

Definition at line 488 of file agent.c.

References delete_ls(), names, names_size, pert_rng, readfile(), and run().

int nextCombination ( int *  positions,
int  size,
int  numFs,
int  reset 
)

Changes the given int array to contain the next combination of numbers. No number is repeated more than once.

Example. Suppose we have the numbers {0,1,2,3,4} and want to choose three numbers each time. Then there are 10 combinations of 3 numbers and so this method will return:
0,1,2
0,1,3
0,1,4
0,2,3
0,2,4
0,3,4
1,2,3
1,2,4
1,3,4
2,3,4

Some parts of this algorithm was obtained from:
    Kenneth H. Rosen, "Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications", 2nd edition,
    McGraw-Hill, 1991, pp. 284-286.

Parameters:
positions The array to contain the combinations of numbers.
size The size of the positions array.
numFs The number of 'F's in the L-System (and hence the largest number to be written in the positions array).
reset Set this parameter to true (1) to reset the combination to (0,0,...,0).
Returns:
True (1) if another combination was returned.

int numInsertions ( int *  positions,
int  size,
fpos_struct *  fposArray,
int  ruleNum 
)

Returns the number of 'F's that will be replaced in the specified rule.

Parameters:
positions The combination 'F's to replace.
size The size of the positions array.
fposArray The fpos_struct array containing the locations of all 'F' in the L-System.
ruleNum The rule for which you want to know how many 'F' in it will be replaced.
Returns:
ruleNum The number of 'F's that will be replaced in the specified rule.

Definition at line 236 of file agent.c.

Referenced by run().

void random_perturbation ( ruleobj *  p  ) 

Creates a random perturbation and stores it in the given ruleobj array.

Note: Only the unique characteristics of the perturbation are written to the array (i.e. the scale and angle). The other objects (e.g. 'G', 'F') must already be in the array.

Parameters:
p The ruleobj array (must be of length 8) to store the perturbation.

void run ( lsystem **  pop,
int  size 
)

Creates different perturbations of an L-System in the given lsystem array. and tries to find the most fit/difficult perturbed L-System.

Parameters:
pop An array of L-Systems (of which only one is used by this agent).
size The size of the pop array.
